Welcome to Poker Game in Python’s documentation!¶

class cardlib.AceCard(suit: Suit)¶

Bases: PlayingCard

A class that creates Aces playing cards

class cardlib.Hand(cards=None)¶

Bases: object

This class represent a hand with cards

best_poker_hand(table_cards=None)¶

This function determines the best pokerhand that a hand can achieve :param table_cards: Cards that is shared by all players and can be used to create a pokerhand :return: The pokerhand with the highest rank and the highest card

class cardlib.HandValue(value)¶

Bases: IntEnum

Enum class that represent all the different hand types possible in poker

Bases: PlayingCard

A class that creates King playing cards

class cardlib.NumberedCard(value: int, suit: Suit)¶

Bases: PlayingCard

A class representing all the numbered cards e.g. card 2-10

class cardlib.PlayingCard(suit)¶

Bases: ABC

Parent class for the different types of playing cards

class cardlib.PokerHand(cards)¶

Bases: object

This class is used to declare the different available poker-hands through static methods

check()¶

This method loops through the static methods until it finds the best pokerhand :return: Best pokerhand and the highest card in that hand :type: tuple

class cardlib.QueenCard(suit: Suit)¶

Bases: PlayingCard

A class that creates Queen playing cards

class cardlib.StandardDeck¶

Bases: object

This class is used for representing a standard deck of cards. The deck will contain 52 unique cards
